requirement_designation: Science, Nature and Technology with Lab
class_notes: Students in a remote research environment will learn how to prepare and characterize synthetic and biological polymers to study their function and properties. Methods for the construction of these polymers present an interesting contrast, as they are generated using the techniques of both organic chemistry and biological organism expression. The properties of these polymer classes also differ significantly, owing to the unique composition and structure of each, which allows for a comparison of the benefits and limitations of synthetic and biological polymers considering their inherent function.
course_description: The relationship between sequence, structure, and function of macromolecules focusing on the practical aspects of macromolecular synthesis, structural and functional characterization, and degradation.
prerequisites: (CHEM 203L or CHEM_OX 203L or CHEM 203ZL as prerequisite) and (CHEM 204 or CHEM_OX 204 as co-requisite) or equivalent transfer credit.
